toolName: GO annotations to phenotyped IMPC genes
description: This is a tool to explore the mappings of phenotype completed and started genes in IMPC to GO terms. It also helps to quickly find the IMPC phenotyped genes that GO has not yet annotated. The dataset can be exported as TSV or Excel format.

This is a table of IMPC/IKMC related publications. The interface contains a filter where users can type in keywords to search for related papers. The keyword is searched against allele symbol, paper title, Journal title, date of publication, grant agency and mesh terms.

toolName: IMPReSS (International Mouse Phenotyping Resource of Standardised Screens)
description: It contains standardized phenotyping protocols which are essential for the characterization of mouse phenotypes. IMPReSS contains definitions of the phenotyping Pipelines and mandatory and optional Procedures and Parameters carried out and data collected by international mouse clinics following the protocols defined. This allows data to be comparable and shareable and ontological annotations permit interspecies comparison which may help in the identification of phenotypic mouse-models of human diseases.
Gene KO effect comparator: how do parameters vary in relation to each other.
An interactive web application with integrated media viewer for comparative visualisation of genotypes and phenotypes.
RIKEN BioResource partners provides IMPC data in a Resource Description Framework (RDF) via the RIKEN MetaDatabase.
